website_summaries.verdict: The best budget pair of FPV goggles with a good set of features for racing and high performance.
pros: Goggles include a large 5" viewing area and 800 x 480 pixels for high-definition-quality images
The automatic search function makes it easy to connect with most general drones
cons: Included strap can start to loosen under the heavy weight of the goggles

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice goggles
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice inexpensive goggles. They can be modded if you wear glasses as in my case. I got some cheap readers and took off the ear pieces and inserted them and it works great. I also like the option to mount to a tripod mount and the option to remove the hood and use it as a screen for others to see. The video out in my case can be used to a spare battery operated tv for others to see while I use the goggles, cool stuff! I enjoy these goggles and recommend them. I was not compsated in this review.
customer_reviews.author: Mark DaleTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Easy, quick with no setup time!
customer_reviews.text: Easy, quick with no setup time! I'm new to the FPV world. I had an av receiver with a small FPV cam. The EV800 seamlessly found my receiver and began displaying the camera in less than 3 seconds. Up and running in no time. Clear picture and no issues. Light, comfortable and durable. I'm certain there are fancier FPV goggles out there but this one gets you up and running immediately without breaking the back. I strongly recommend buying the circular polarized antennae...it drastically expands your FPV experience with slightly longer distances.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Perez

customer_reviews.title: Budget headset. Superb quality.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of video on these is quite impressive for the price. I also own a pair of Eachine VR007 and the difference is mind blowing. Also the ease of adding a DVR to this headset is awesome. With my limited soldering skills I got it hooked up in less than 20 minutes. If you're on a budget, these are perfect for flying around a small park, your house, or your backyard. Not the greatest signal strength out of the box, but add a nice cloverleaf antenna and you will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: NuggzFPV

customer_reviews.title: these goggles are incredible very comfortable and easy to use it immediately bound with my ...
customer_reviews.text: when i crushed my lower spine life was 0ver. until i watched the drone racing league. wow now i can fly. thank you eachine with your new ev800fpv goggles and my walkera 110 rodeo my dream has been realized.these goggles are incredible very comfortable and easy to use it immediately bound with my hubson fpv and my walkera 250 as well as my 110 rodeo .i could not be happier will recommend to all who wish to fly eachine please keep me posted when you up grade with internal dvr. again thank you .
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey b.Lifeson

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Two Weeks. Shuts off randomly mid-flight
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 2 weeks. Now it turns off mid flight, which has resulted in multiple crashed drones. It would then not turn back on for hours. With the battery still fully charged. And speaking of charging batteries, the goggles did NOT come with a charger. I have to buy one separate. I'm thinking I might have gotten a lemon, I've heard of these being fairly reliable. But I'm severely disappointed with the one I got, complete waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Gergify

customer_reviews.title: good entry goggles *update*
customer_reviews.text: Good Picture quality and no latency that i can see. feels a bit cheap as far as materials go but only time will tell. light weight and easy to use. pretty good for a first pair of goggles. cant fit glasses under them and the face pad doesnt seem to want to stick well near the bottom areas. *update* Lost my on button today, and took it apart to find out what happened. Switch broke inside. Also not too happy with the quality of the solder inside, looks very poorly done. It's a shame though because I really enjoy the picture quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: anthony kemnitz

customer_reviews.title: Good starter goggles at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by the low price. These are very good starter goggles at a great price.The image is very clear and channel/band tuning is easy. The only complaint I had with the goggles is that for me the screen seems to be a little too close which causes a little eye strain. In hind sight, I would have bought the EV800D. The image is comparable on both goggles and the diversity option and DVR features are well worth the additional $$$
customer_reviews.author: Caduceus26

customer_reviews.title: This is a great deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal for the price. However they don't seem to work well for me, it seems that the screen is way too close to my face. I build a mock-up extension out of cardboard which moves the screen another 2 inches of so, and that works very well, however it looks like I'm wearing a shoe box on my face! The reception is excellent on my unit with the stock antenna, and I use a 200mw transmitter. I get over 1/4 mile range through trees, walls and even parked cars.
customer_reviews.author: Tomic

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance at a good price
customer_reviews.text: These have been working well for my inductrix for awhile now. Nothing about them I would change really. No built in dvr or diversity, but those things effect price which effects me buying them. I can't mention much about range, but around the house and backyard they are very clear and only cut out through several walls. These now come with foam, and I find them plenty comfortable. This is my first headset like this, and it makes fpv a lot more fun for several reasons like huge fov, and really helps focus with no peripheral distractions. The battery life is nice, although I'm pretty close cracking it open to add a real charging cable, those 5v cables are lame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level Goggles but only for people who don't need reading glasses!
customer_reviews.text: This set of FPV goggles works well with my Husband 501S FPV Quadcopter. However, even though my reading vision is good to about 10 inches, the display is slightly out of focus. My 13year old had no problems. In addition, the video reception with the supplied antenna was marginal. I switched to the CrazePony PFV 5.8G Panel Antenna and got much better reception. Overall, a great add-on for FPV Quadcopters where you want to supplement the Controller Display with goggles so get better images in bright sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: RaminG

customer_reviews.title: Not the latest version.
customer_reviews.text: The one I got had the AV connection cord but not the port in the goggles. Evidently I got last generation EV800 packaged with current generation accessories.
customer_reviews.author: The Creeper

customer_reviews.title: Great Goggles
customer_reviews.text: These are super goggles. They're fun and easy to use and I love how the screen can be used in the goggles or easily pulls out to be used separately. Only downside is that after about 2 days of use the strap broke on me. Looks like the stitching was inadequate, but this is the only issue I've had with these.
customer_reviews.author: Tristen

customer_reviews.title: Battery malfunction
customer_reviews.text: I had it for three days there was a battery malfunction and when I tried to charge it , it wouldn’t charge and I referred to YouTube for help and the manual and nothing. I was looking forward to it and now I’m stuck with nothing
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Google with a very decent picture
customer_reviews.text: Great Google with a very decent picture. Simple cheap and works. The screen does detach from the face piece which is nice when others want to see. The kids love holding it and watching. Wish it had DVr and good diversity.
customer_reviews.author: Penpen

customer_reviews.title: Not for eyeglass wearers
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to be able to use these with eyeglasses but it is not possible even with the smallest readers I could fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jane D.

customer_reviews.title: Great set of entry level fpv goggles
customer_reviews.text: Great set of entry level fpv goggles. Receiver module on it provides good reception with minimal breakup. A great feature is you can remove the eye piece. I removed mine and mounted mine to a tripod and created a viewing station for others to watch from my perspective.
customer_reviews.author: wtomas

customer_reviews.title: Can’t see the screen.
customer_reviews.text: As an old guy, I couldn’t see the screen at all. I needed to glue in my cheaters in order to use. Maybe for a young guy these might work better. If you have any problems reading fine print, don’t get these.
customer_reviews.author: SpyderMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Nice goggles, good features for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Nice goggles, good features for the price! Built-in rechargeable battery and video receiver means you're good to go out of the box. I received the updated version with face foam and A/V port. Included antenna works, but upgrade to a better one when you can. Picture is clear, it's not full HD but make sure you get at least an 800VTL camera (I started with a 600VTL and the image was squished vertically). The unit is lighter than I thought, and I especially like how I can detach the harness and use the screen as a standalone monitor when I'm at the work bench.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Need better quality control
customer_reviews.text: Purchased primarily due to screen size and resolution. Both were as advertised. I have two issues. First is that screen aspect ratio cannot be changed. And secondly, On/Off button broke after just a few presses. Luckily I was able to fix it on own but that should never break. Need better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its really good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Clear picture, cheap and the ability to use the screen as a monitor when you decide to upgrade is a big plus. Didn't give it 5 stars because, its really good for the price, but still missing all the features of a higher end goggles. Can't record with these mainly.
customer_reviews.author: Akira2k1

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of goggles if you’re in the market this ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of goggles if you’re in the market this is a good starter set for fpv highly recommend great customer service
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit. Huge viewing area
customer_reviews.text: Took my glasses off and I could see everything clearly wearing the goggles. Comfortable fit. Huge viewing area. Nice and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Joy A Jones

customer_reviews.title: The picture and range seem good. It quickly found my VTX on my drone ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first FPV goggles so not much to base it off of. The picture and range seem good. It quickly found my VTX on my drone and displayed the picture with out me doing much at all. I swapped out the antennae and it may have made the range alittle better. Still happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: KevinMc

customer_reviews.title: impressive
customer_reviews.text: i bought these... then a month later i bought fatshark HD3's.. i honestly like the ev800's better. returned the fatsharks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just wish it was a hair lighter. But if you wear a hat, turn it backwards and the Goggles won't slide off your face.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Crane

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Search is a little too sensitive, but works a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua F.

customer_reviews.title: Great For FPV
customer_reviews.text: Update 8/8- I was contacted by the seller and they made things right. Took the googles out yesterday for a proper FPV flight, and these things are awesome! Great picture quality and comfortable on the face. As long as you get the newer set with the cloth pad, I highly recommend these goggles. Leaving my original review for posterity. I ordered 2 different pairs at 2 different times, making sure both times that they stated "Upgraded version". First pair ordered 7/28/16 were clearly the original design with no foam padding. VERY uncomfortable. Second pair ordered 7/31/16 ended up being the old design with a foam pad tossed in the box, no AV port, tiny headphone jack.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent glasses for starters, the quality is good and it fits fine on your head
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Better than spending $400+
customer_reviews.text: Better than spending $400 and more for make brand goggles. Having a good time with them.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: These are great for a first goggle or a spare set for ...
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with this thing for the price! I own a pair of Fatshark V3's and while these are bulkier, the image is bigger. These are great for a first goggle or a spare set for a spectator. The ability to remove the monitor/receiver from the head gear is a big plus. The materials feel top notch and I wish my V3's could channel scan like these can Unfortunately, none of these monitor-attached-to-a-shroud types of goggles will ever compare to Fatsharks, but its hard to beat at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: David Cote

customer_reviews.title: Comes with face pad
customer_reviews.text: People say these hurt their face so they add 3M padding, but my set came with a pad!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: For the price paid a great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Still getting use to them but they work. For the price paid a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: RemyMartin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It looks little wierd when you put this on you face retty decent goggle for FPV.
customer_reviews.author: Quadcopter flyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: Picture is good gets kind of fuzzy around trees but can still see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Over priced and my battery has never held a charge
customer_reviews.author: stephen hammond

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, it arrives as planned and seems to work quite well! thanks very much.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: worked fine the first day than the power button broke
customer_reviews.author: May

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and well thought design.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the price. Much better view than the compact googles.
customer_reviews.author: Yu Ko

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it for my tiny whoop. I use the craze pony camera with it
customer_reviews.author: Sebas Lopez alejos

customer_reviews.title: Finally flying FPV
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to FPV and I don't have allot of background when it comes to setting everything up. This was simple and works great for me. I've really enjoyed using it and the fact that it comes apart is just a bonus. The only cons: The Antenna I think I will be ordering a replacement antenna as the signal strength could be improved. Some light comes in from below however it hasn't had any effect to the view or flying in general. Overall, very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER

customer_reviews.title: [UPDATE] The goggles are neat and the screen is nice. However the power button is starting to stick ...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The goggles died after 4 months of light use. I smelled something burn inside the goggles and I can't power them off. I cannot recommend this product, very cheap. The goggles are neat and the screen is nice. However the power button is starting to stick and there are 2 buttons to increment the band and 2 buttons to increment the channel instead of increment/decrement buttons for both. But aside from that, it's pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good Starter Set
customer_reviews.text: Perfect starter set, mine came with mushroom antenna instead of dipole like image shows. Either way it was replaced with matching clover antennas. Only been a month of fpv almost daily, and im thinking of stepping my game up as quality isn't the greatest. Love the detachable goggle to monitor setup to.
customer_reviews.author: XCR

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice set up i like the 2 piece idea. if you wear glasses not so good
customer_reviews.author: jim harris

customer_reviews.title: I love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love these goggles they are my first pair. I almost got the eachine vr700 and I'm glad I got the ev800 instead. I saw a lot of YouTube videos where the goggles didn't have the padding but because I got them from Amazon and this certain pair it came with the padding and other stuff. I'm very happy with the resolution there's a bunch of settings in the menu and happy with the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: 😊

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Not the updated model
customer_reviews.text: Edit: No response from Eachine yet. I think I may return the goggles and order directly through Banggood. This clearly shows it's the upgraded model in the description! It has neither the face pad or AV in. This is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Blatchford

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price.....  So far.
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I haven't tried in the field yet. For around only $100 I am surprised. They are lighter than they look. Nice rubber matte finish. On-screen indicators for channel, battery and signal strength which my $350 V3 brand I won't mention goggles annoyingly won't do. Clear, adequately back-lit screen. The strap and hood slide off to give you a small screen if you don't want to wear them for whatever reason. Well constructed, everything fits together precisely. Cons: It seems like the battery is sealed and hard to access, no dvr, no diversity but it's only $90.
customer_reviews.author: Solder Succor

customer_reviews.title: Better than fat shark HD's
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are awesome. I've had them for a few weeks now, and thought it would be a cheap way to hold me over until I could save up for fat sharks. Well my buddy brought his fat shark hd2's over for me to try out, and they were horrible! This $90 goggle I bought has a bigger image and a much clearer picture! I may look like I'm wearing a shoe box on my face, but it's worth it to keep $400 in my pocket! I'm buying 2 more for my kids!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hallock

customer_reviews.title: Get the ev800D
customer_reviews.text: They are great goggles, but get the D version. You have to have the goggles DVR to find lost quads, and if your quad doesn’t have a DVR cam on it. The diversity is nice too. I upgraded a few months after having this to another goggle because I needed the DVR. The range is decent, battery life is ok. It Would be nice to have external batteries to switch out if it gets low. Just have to remember to plug in after you fly. Very good begginer goggles, great picture quality. Not too heavy and they are decently comfortable. Would recommend for a begginer, well the 800D !!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Stoked About These!
customer_reviews.text: For the money you can't get a better starter FPV rig. They have a big enough screen to give you confidence, and the antenna is fine to use until your omni-directional cloverleaf or pagoda style upgrade arrives. Also know that this uses an RP-SMA male connection. It's kinda weird they call it a male when you look at it but that's what it uses. I ordered some SMA-Male antennas for it and was disappointed to see that they wouldn't work. Thankfully they work as replacements for the on-board antenna on the quad.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner goggles
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I like that i can pop the screen off the rest of the goggles and use them on my work bench. You simply can't compare these to the higher end fatshark goggles which are way more expensive. The bottom line is if I didn't have fatsharks, these would be my go to goggles and it's what i keep in my bag to show people who ask what i'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: Jimp.1

customer_reviews.title: really good
customer_reviews.text: Veryyyyy pleased with these, good quality, good settings and layout, and receive video well. The sraps are comfortable and it really doesnt weight much, even tho people say it does cause they just like fat sharks or something but in all seriousness they are nottt heavy at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Theese goggles are great for beginners.m a little heavy but bang for buck probably the best out there. If you decide you dont like the goggles they can also be used as a 5 inch monitor.
customer_reviews.author: zachary

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love these so far. For the price you just can't go wrong. They do what they say they do. I received the updated version with the thick foam around the face and regular headphone jack. No complaints. Love the fact that it is all in one single unit and not pouches with the stuff in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: I really like how The goggles can be used on your head ...
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I could find with these is not having a dvr although it was not very difficult to add one. Just buy the eachine prodvr and search youtube for the video on adding it. I really like how The goggles can be used on your head and on a mount. It makes line of sight tuning a breeze with a mount and an osd capable of tuning through.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ridealong goggles
customer_reviews.text: These are great as your first set of goggles or as a ridealong / external monitor if you meet people at the field or in public. If you want a DVR, check out the EV800D eachine box goggles. But if you just want a simple one-antenna monitor, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great, receiver is good
customer_reviews.text: Great, receiver is good, resolution is perfect. Can't beat the price! Though I don't trust the battery level meter. I was showing 1/2 battery while flying and suddenly it shut off, and wouldn't come back on. Charged it up and it worked fine again, but I'm wary about the battery level now.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Jernigan

customer_reviews.title: backlight didn't work
customer_reviews.text: When I received mine, the back light was not working. I could not see the screen at all, until I turned it at just the right angle. These also looked like the older style with out the upgrades. I sent them back for a refund, and went with the EV800D version. I probably just got a bad pair.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyB

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit fat faces.
customer_reviews.text: These fit small faces. My face is very wide. I was able to make them fit by changing to a different molded (custom) foam. As for cooperation. Thy are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Rasmusen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: fairly clear vision, just need to get over my fear when wearing them. I would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great but the goggles are huge compared to more expensive and hang down on face. Hard to adjust strap perfectly however great for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing worth every doller don't invest in $500 fat sharks when you can get these for $100
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck hands down
customer_reviews.text: I fly fpv and hunt wild boar I use these little gems for both I have a fatshark teleporter 5 and the cost was around 200. And they are nowhere as good or long battery life trust me buy these and you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. I added DVR mod to mine to record flights. Very affordable FPV goggles, perfect for getting into the hobby.
customer_reviews.author: philyup8

customer_reviews.title: Big screen small price
customer_reviews.text: Big screen, great price. Wish I went with DVR version. Antenna is RP-SMA
customer_reviews.author: joshua Fleming

customer_reviews.title: and is very comfortable. Very happy camper here
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this cannot be beat. Pic quality is clear as day. Simple to use, and is very comfortable. Very happy camper here.
customer_reviews.author: hockey pups

customer_reviews.title: The video quality is very good with my Blade Nano QX2
customer_reviews.text: The video quality is very good with my Blade Nano QX2. I am not used to wearing goggles and flying without running into everything yet so I am really impressed with how the monitor is removable.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Detachable screen is great when spectators want to see what FPV is all about.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Miller

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Goggles are nice but can't were my glasses,have to mount on a tripod
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Piatkowski

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great headset for beginners, it has a big display and is pretty easy to operate, like that you can use it as a regular screen, battery could last longer but that's probably make them heavier, it does come with a charging cable to connect to a Li-po battery when out flying
customer_reviews.author: Elllllloo

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It connects to my Husband H501 without problem. I am going to use it for drone racing.
customer_reviews.author: Panther

customer_reviews.title: Great goggle
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these goggles, and the fact that you can separate the screen it is great for friends and family to watch. I bought these while I waited for my eachine vr d2 to come in. I actually liked these a little bit better on my face, but I will say they feel heavier when you look up or down on your face, but they are definitely a great goggle. Same video quality as my vr d2 just without DVR, they are a little heavier, and a little bigger. These also have "video in" if you need it. I feel like this internal battery last twice as long as my external lipo on the VR D2 as well.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, I added a dvr to the mix and other than I wish I could wear my glasses these are great for the money
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: they are the best fpv goggles for the money
customer_reviews.text: they are the best fpv goggles for the money, I use them all the time flying fpv,,very clear pic, and you can put them on a try pod,,for fpv,
customer_reviews.author: josey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to the expensive goggles out there. Easy to use. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Markus Hochmuth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The screen is amazing and found my camera without a problem
customer_reviews.author: Jason D

customer_reviews.title: The product arrived on time and the box it was in was in great condition. I opened it up and I'm adjusting ...
customer_reviews.text: The price seemed right. The product arrived on time and the box it was in was in great condition. I opened it up and I'm adjusting the headset just to find out that the left side of the headband is all frayed and worn out. I haven't even had a flight session yet!. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: No glasses needed
customer_reviews.text: These are a great deal for the money. I have no problem going 200-300 feet away and still have a crystal clear picture. And I love how I don't need to wear my glasses when I use these.
customer_reviews.author: Rigsbee

customer_reviews.title: They work great have amazing battery life and the only reason I ...
customer_reviews.text: These were my first goggles and now they're my trainer goggles. They work great have amazing battery life and the only reason I upgraded was because I wanted DVR
customer_reviews.author: zombiesurvivor

customer_reviews.title: Great goggles for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great starter pair of goggles to get you into FPV. Video quality is excellent with an upgraded antenna, I use foxeer circular polarized antenna on both the Video transmitter and the goggles. My only gripe is the band doesn't come with the reinforced plastic as shown in the photo, and it's difficult to adjust to your head.
customer_reviews.author: Talab Ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy - won't power up
customer_reviews.text: These goggles didn't last. I purchased them in July, and now they won't power up at all. I have them plugged into a 2s external battery but no luck. It started out with the lights on the front light turning on while charging and the battery always showing zero power, which I could live with. But now they are totally useless because won't power up with any power source.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Kind of useless - wireless only
customer_reviews.text: Picture shows the video in cable but unit received has no video input port and no video in cable. Kind of useless for wifi only...
customer_reviews.author: VegasScientific

product_meta.title: EACHINE EV800 5 Inches 800x480 FPV Goggles Video Glasses 5.8G 40CH Raceband Auto-Searching Build in Battery
feature_bullets: Separable design, 5 inch screen can be used as small monitor on radio controller or with tripod
Come with advanced auto-searching function ad show you the working frequency on screen
